languageKey.label: From the 4.5 release multiple methods have been deprecated. Changing them to their respective new methods would solve the issue.
Calling deprecated methods will give an error as they have been removed.
Deprecated static methods
From the 4.5 release some view helpers have been deprecated. Changing them to their respective new view helpers would solve the issue.
Calling deprecated view helpers will give an error as they have been removed.
Deprecated view helpers
As the database API has been switched to MySQLi, the mysql_* function don't work anymore. Replace them with API calls.
Using mysql_* functions instead of the database API will give errors due the the change to MySQLi.
Use of mysql_* functions
The new TYPO3 LTS version uses namespaced classes. Update the old core classnames to the namespaced versions
Some extensions use non-namespaced core classnames.
Use of non-namespaced classnames

The constant PATH_t3lib has been removed. The code in the old t3lib directory has been relocated. You may solve most of the issues found by this check by first running the check and migration for 'requireOnceInExtensions'.
Code using the removed constant PATH_t3lib will fail.
Removed constants

While namespacing all the classes have been restructured, relocated and renamed. Including old files therefore will fail. Since TYPO3 CMS 4.3 there is an autoloader which makes manual requiring superfluous: simply use the needed classes.
Using require_once, include_once, include or require on core files will fail since files have been relocated.
require_once // include_once
When changing you might also need to change the location/name of the hook or add the file to the ext_autoload.php.
The way of registering xClasses has been changed. Check if xClassing is used.
Check for xClasses
Since DAM won't work in 6.x anymore, you should remove all calls to DAM-Methods and Instances of DAM-Classes and change them to use FAL/Media.
DAM will be gone in 6.x so you can't use it's Classes anymore.
Dam Classes
UTF-8 ensures your database will be able to store multiple languages without any data conversions being done while storing or retrieving the values.
Check if your database and tables are UTF-8.
UTF-8 readiness check
Extensions can specify the TYPO3 versions they are compatible with.
Lists the extensions incompatible with the current LTS version.
Extensions incompatible with current LTS
Extensions can specify in their ext_emconf.php status field if they are obsolete.
Lists the extensions that are marked as obsolete.
Obsolete extensions
Checks
Extension Report

Report
Replace deprecated methods method calls with new ones.
Replace deprecated methods method calls with new ones
Replace old core classnames with namespaced versions
Replace old core classnames with namespaced versions

Try and replace all reported require/include calls
The way of registering xClasses has been changed. Migrate the notation to the new form.
Fix xclass notation

Fix database

Call to deprecated static method
Replace the static method %s in %s on line %s.
require_once // include_once usage
Remove the %s statement in %s on line %s.

The Class "%s" is registered as replacement for "%s" via xClass-Mechanism. The new class won't be executed after upgrading to 6.2 as the method of registering xclasses has changed in TYPO3 CMS 6.0. Please check if the xclass-code is still needed in after upgrading to TYPO3 6.2 LTS and in that case register it the new way.
$GLOBALS['TYPO3_CONF_VARS']['SYS']['Objects']['%s'] = array('className' => '%s');
Remove the XCLASS Code at %s. Add the following code there: \n $GLOBALS['TYPO3_CONF_VARS']['SYS']['Objects']['%s'] = array('className' => '%s');
Usage of DAM-Classes
Replace the Usage of DAM with FAL-Functionalities: %s in %s on line %s.
Replace the database character set from '%s' to 'utf8' and the default collation from '%s' to 'utf8_general_ci'.
Replace column collation on table '%s', column '%s' from characterset '%s' and collation '%s' to 'utf8' and 'utf_general_ci'.
Replace database server setting '%s' from '%s' to '%s'.
Replace table collation on table '%s' from '%s' to '%s'.
